entry.title: A Guide to Building Your Own Hexo Blog
entry.content:
Preface

Along with the rapid development of internet, more and more social media platforms grew popularity around the globe, allowing the flow of information to be more efficient than ever. These platforms are easy to use in all aspects. However, we have that geek spirit. To be honest with yourself, have you never dreamed of owning a website of your own? A place where you can share what you care about and what you care about only. Technology, lifestyle, science, art; and the list of topic goes on. Let’s do this together, learning this whole blog thing from 0 to 1 (wink).

What is Hexo?

Hexo is a static blog framework based on Node.js that uses very little dependencies and installation. Hexo can help you generate static webpages to be hosted on GitHub and Heroku easily. In this tutorial, we will be using GitHub Pages as our hosting service. Hexo is also an open-source project on GitHub, which you can learn more here. For more detail please visit their (official website)[https://hexo.io/].

还有要说的一点就是Hexo的创始人是台湾人，因此Hexo对中文的支持非常友好。

Outline

  1. Get a personal domain (optional)
  2. Create new a respiratory on GitHub
  3. Install Git
  4. Install Nodes.js
  5. Install Hexo
  6. Publish website
  7. Use your custom domain (optional)
  8. Change to your preferred theme
  9. Basic MarkDown syntax
  10. Publish your first article
  11. Find a image hosting service
  12. Personalization
